column4: Hello! can i easily upgrade the kernel to 2.6.17 through any update manager(or similar) if i install kubuntu 6.06? The reason im asking is because i have an ibook witch uses the broadcom chipset in the airport extreme. And i want an easy kernel upgrade.
just apt-get install the kernel package and reboot
'sudo apt-get install linux-686' for instance, but see what NoUse says
